---
author: Jen Carlson
date: Dec 22, 2015 4:30 pm
title: Scroll Through Our Best Instagram Pics Of 2015
---

	
										<p>Below, a look back at some of our favorite Instagram photos of 2015, all taken by our writers and photographers... and with a surprise cameo from <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160428152041/http://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/the-most-famous-dog-in-the-world-on-instagram">Marnie the dog</a>. </p>

<p>If you aren&apos;t following us on Instagram, you can do so here: <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160428152041/https://www.instagram.com/gothamist">instagram.com/Gothamist</a>.</p>

<blockquote class="instagram-media" data-instgrm-captioned="" data-instgrm-version="6" style=" background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:658px; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px);"><div style="padding:8px;"> <div style=" background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:50% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;"> <div style=" background:url(data:image/png;base64,); display:block; height:44px; margin:0 auto -44px; position:relative; top:-22px; width:44px;"></div></div> <p style=" margin:8px 0 0 0; padding:0 4px;"> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160428152041/https://www.instagram.com/p/xhQQx4LEFU/" style=" color:#000; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; font-style:normal; font-weight:normal; line-height:17px; text-decoration:none; word-wrap:break-word;" target="_blank">Snow day (photo by @navidbaraty)</a></p> <p style=" color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;">A photo posted by Gothamist (@gothamist) on <time style=" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px;" datetime="2015-01-06T16:42:22+00:00">Jan 6, 2015 at 8:42am PST</time></p></div></blockquote>
